snippet: The Palestinian negotiators on Thursday offered to resign in protest over the continuing construction of Israeli settlements, but the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, was not likely to accept them.
abstract: Palestinian negotiators engaged in peace talks with Israel offer their resignations in protest over continuing construction of Israeli settlements and what Palestinians say is a lack of strong American action on issue.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The Palestinian negotiators on Thursday offered to resign in protest over the continuing construction of Israeli settlements, but the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, was not likely to accept them.

headline.main: Palestinians in Peace Talks With Israel Offer Resignations
headline.print_headline: Palestinians In Peace Talks With Israel Are Resigning
